intro: Eria cristata, commonly known as the crested spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, and often lobed leaves, which are usually arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in the spring. Eria cristata is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
